info.name: GitHub API Collection
info.description: > A simple collection based on [GitHub API V3](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference) ## Features - Get Profile Information - Create repository on GitHub - Create Issues on any repository in GitHub - Delete your repository - Check health of GitHub API ## Getting Started Generate a [Personal Access Token](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/guides/getting-started-with-the-rest-api#authentication) with the following grants: - Repo:all - Delete Repo The Collection uses the following Collection Variables: - `username` : Fill in your GitHub Username - `url` : The base URL endpoint of GitHub v3 API - `repoName`: \[OPTIONAL\] the repo to delete, and create issues on. Is automatically set using Postman Tests. Collection By: [Hemanth Krishna](https://github.com/DarthBenro008)

item.name: Check API Health (Get a random philosophical quote)

request.description: This API Endpoint checks the Health of GitHub API. It returns a random design philosophical quote

response.name: Check API Health (Get a random philosophical quote)

header.value: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, Deprecation, Sunset

request.description:
This API Call will get the user information.

- Username must be defined in collection variable

request.description:
Creates a repository on behalf of the user.

Must note that one should have provided an access token with ample access such as:

- Repo Creation
- Repo Deletion
- Admin Permission

header.value: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, Deprecation, Sunset

item.name: Create an Issue in a repository

request.description:
Creates an Issue on behalf of the user on any repository.

Repository username and name can be modified in CollectionVariables or can be given an input in path variables

response.name: Create an Issue in a repository

header.value: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, Deprecation, Sunset
